result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan R Gonzalez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Expires 4/26/2018
The deft shall commit no violation of criminal law to the level of probable cause "probable cause" shall be the level of proof needed to sustain the sufficiency of the criminal complaint of a misd, or that level of proof needed to sustain a bindover for trial if a felony.
If the DCA is not revoked, the charge shall be dismissed with prejudice.
No revocation may take place without a hearing before the Court with notice served upon all parties.
Current bond conditions shall remain in effect during the life of this agreement.
Deft specifically waives his/her right to a speedy trial, disposition or any applicable statute of limitations to the charge covered by this DCA.
In the event the expiration date of this DCA has passed, nothing in this DCA or the laws of the State of WI shall prevent the State from seeking revocation of this DCA if the State has filed a motion to revoke this DCA prior to the expiration date.
Deft agrees to maintain his/her current address with the Clerk of Courts office.  Any change shall be updated with the Clerk of Courts office within 72 hours of the change.  The defendant further agrees that any court notice mailed to the most recent address he/she has on with the Clerk of Courts office is notice for any further court hearings on this case.
Deft shall comply with all probation rules and regulations of the supervision ordered in this case's other conviction(s).
That the defendant shall undergo any counseling required by the probation agent and complete said counseling.
That the defendant shall have no contact with the victim in this case except as authorized in any family court orders and shall stipulate and sign all papers necessary in any family court proceeding in which the defendant and victim are parties to the action to allow the victim to relocate to her home in another state with her children.

If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmates monies to pay fines/costs with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.
